what: Fitting the Generalized Extreme Value Distribution constrained to Positive Shape Parameters
title: Fitting the Generalized Extreme Value Distribution constrained to Positive Shape Parameters
text: R-package functions Fitting Generalized Extreme Value Distribution constrained Positive Shape Parameters Based Moccia et al., 2021

title: Fitting the Generalized Extreme Value Distribution constrained to Positive Shape Parameters
text: can install development version gevplus GitHub :

what: Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
title: Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
text: Negative GEV shape parameters considered artifacts sample uncertainties. GEV+ provides fit data series shape parameters >= 0. L-skewness smaller equal ln(9/8)/ln2, Gumbel distribution fit, otherwise GEV. Adapted 10.1016/j.ejrh.2021.100906

title: Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
text: x vector block maxima. method character string defining method used parameter estimation. Defaults Lmoments.

title: Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
text: list components: type type distribution. method Method used fit distribution. params named vector fitted parameters loc. sacle shape. x data distribution fitted . fit fitting object, either NULL class fevd.

title: Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
code: Moccia, B. et al. (2021) 'Spatial variability of precipitation extremes over Italy using a fine-resolution gridded product', Journal of Hydrology: Regional Studies. Elsevier Ltd, 37 (October). doi: 10.1016/j.ejrh.2021.100906.

title: Generalized extreme value distribution constrained to positive shape parameters (GEV+) — fgevplus
code: z <- extRemes::revd(100, loc = 20, scale = 0.5, shape = -0.2) fit <- fgevplus(z) fit$params[3] #> shape  #>     0   z <- extRemes::revd(100, loc = 20, scale = 0.5, shape = 0.2) fit <- fgevplus(z) fit$params[3] #>      shape  #> 0.03285595

what: Plot graphs of GEV+ fit — plot.gevplus
title: Plot graphs of GEV+ fit — plot.gevplus
text: return level plot, qq-plot, pp-plot histogram fitted density produced

title: Plot graphs of GEV+ fit — plot.gevplus
code: # S3 method for class 'gevplus' plot(   x,   q = c(2, 10, 20, 30, 50, 75, 100, 150, 200),   ci = FALSE,   type = c("all", "rl", "qq", "pp", "hist"),   ... )

title: Plot graphs of GEV+ fit — plot.gevplus
text: x object classgevplus q vector return periods, \(q > 1\). ci ci=TRUE, confidence intervals computed. type omitted panel return level plot (type='rl', density plot (type='hist'), qq-plot (type='qq') probability plot (tpe='pp') shown. ... parameters plotting confidence interval calculation (alpha, R) may also supplied arguments. See e.g. plot.

title: Plot graphs of GEV+ fit — plot.gevplus
Plot graphs of GEV+ fit — plot.gevplus
code: z <- extRemes::revd(100, loc = 20, scale = 10, shape = -0.2) fit <- fgevplus(z) plot(fit, ci = TRUE)   # Compare standard GEV with GEV+ z <- rnorm(100) rp <- c(2, 10, 20, 30, 50, 75, 100, 150, 200) fit_gev <- extRemes::fevd(z) fit_gevplus <- fgevplus(z) plot(fit_gev, rperiods = rp, type = "rl", ylim = c(0, max(z) * 1.2), main = paste0(fit_gev$type, " / ", fit_gev$method))  plot(fit_gevplus, q = rp, ci = TRUE, type = "rl")

what: Print method for object of class gevplus — print.gevplus

text: Print nicely formatted output fit GEV+

title: Print method for object of class gevplus — print.gevplus
code: # S3 method for class 'gevplus' print(x, digits = max(3, getOption("digits") - 3), ...)

title: Print method for object of class gevplus — print.gevplus
text: x Object class gevplus, fitted GEV+. digits Number digits. ... Additional parameters.

title: Print method for object of class gevplus — print.gevplus
Print method for object of class gevplus — print.gevplus
code: z <- extRemes::revd(100, loc = 20, scale = 0.5, shape = -0.2) fit <- fgevplus(z) print(fit) #> GEV+ fitting #>  #> Type: GEV+ #> Estimator: Lmoments #>  #> Estimated parameters: #> location     scale     shape   #>  19.9263    0.4182    0.0000

what: Return levels and confidence intervals for the GEV+ — return.level.gevplus
title: Return levels and confidence intervals for the GEV+ — return.level.gevplus
text: function computes return levels confidence intervals GEV+ distribution. handles cases input fit object class 'fevd' . Confidence intervals can constructed parametric bootstrap approach.

title: Return levels and confidence intervals for the GEV+ — return.level.gevplus
code: # S3 method for class 'gevplus' return.level(x, return.period = c(2, 20, 100), ..., do.ci = FALSE)

title: Return levels and confidence intervals for the GEV+ — return.level.gevplus
text: x list returned function fgevplus, .e. object class gevplus. return.period numeric vector return periods. ... Additional parameters alpha R bootstrap procedure. .ci .ci=TRUE, either parametric bootstrap method used calculate confidence intervals level alpha, intrinsic ci functions package extRemes used (see also fevd)

title: Return levels and confidence intervals for the GEV+ — return.level.gevplus
text: tibble containing either estimates additionally lower upper bounds confidence interval.
